flowRoot.flowPara: Number of refugees globallyGraph: Country sources - Syria, Afghanistan...
Number of refugees globallyGraph: Country sources - Syria, Afghanistan...Number of refugees globallyGraph: Country sources - Syria, Afghanistan...

Syria went from 18% of all refugees to 29%.As such, starting in mid-2014,the Syrian Arab Republic replaced Afghanistan asthe main source country of refugees worldwide,a rank Afghanistan had previously held for morethan three decades
paragraph lines: 40 to 55 characters, 8-12 wordsparagraph lines: 40 to 55 characters, 8-12 words
Number of refugees arriving in Europe - Map: sea routes to greece and ItalyCountry sources - Syria, Afghanistan...

tspan.tspan: Making sense of the major players and key factions
Developed Countries like the US and EU wanted universal reductions
Developing Countries like China and India wanted 'climate justice'
Least Developed Countries like most of Africa wanted a 1.5°C limit
The finer points of the Paris Agreement
A consensus was reached on language to keep global warming to
'well below 2°C' and to pursue efforts to limit it to 1.5°C.
The deal uses 'common but differentiated responsibilities' instead of
Annexes. This means that all countries, including developing countries, set
All countries are expected to reach their goals 'as soon as possible', report
on them every five years, and ramp them up over time.
The agreement will officially take effect once it has been ratified by at least
55 countries that together represent at least 55% of global emissions
The Paris Agreement is an international climate change treaty
adopted in December 2015 and signed in April 2016
It was the culmination of years of negotiations

text.tspan: involving virtually every nation in the world
To explain how this agreement was reached,
let's first look at where countries disagreed:
